metadata.title: CVE-2022-1619 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in function cmdline_erase_chars in GitHubrepository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4899. This vulnerabilities are capable ofcrashing software, modify memory, and possible remote execution

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.1').
